front.title: Use of 'RFC-generic' for MPEG-4 Elementary Streams with no SL layer

abstract.t: The MPEG Committee (ISO/IEC JTC1/SC29 WG11) is a working group in ISO that recently produced the MPEG-4 [1] standard. MPEG defines tools to compress content such as audio-visual information into elementary streams. In [6] a generic RTP payload format is defined for transport of any non-multiplexed MPEG-4 elementary stream. To achieve the generic MPEG-4 functionality, [6] addresses detailed issues related to the MPEG-4 SL layer. However, many initial applications will not use the SL Layer. To facilitate usage of [6] by such applications, this document describes how to use [6] when no SL layer is used.
